page.title: 13ST.MARTINS CHURCH,BRASTED
page.content: Our church is on a hill at the edge of the village. There has been a church there for over 1000 years.The tower was built in stages and is 700 years old.It has needed repair and is to be repaired again soon. Above the altar is the beautifully coloured east window of magnificent pictures which looks best when the sun shines through.On the altar,which has different coloured covers during the year stands a cross, candlesticks and a bible on a cushion. There is a brass lectern shaped like an eagle and an old carved wooden pulpit that came from a church in Rochester. The symbols of the evangelists,the ox, eagle, lion and angel are carved on the ends of the choir stalls. The story of St Martin the Roman,is shown in glass on the south side.
